name: places/ChIJYaVdffBYwokRl7TlavHGhVQ
adrFormatAddress: 768 5th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA

editorialSummary.text: Lavish hotel destination presenting high-end champagnes & wines along with caviar service.

originalText.text: Service was truly spectacular!  The food..Amazing. I don't know what type of ice cream they use but MAN..it was GOOD!   No lie you will spend a pretty penny eating and drinking but it's definitely worth it! ( I recommend the wagyu burger)

text.text: Service was truly spectacular!  The food..Amazing. I don't know what type of ice cream they use but MAN..it was GOOD!   No lie you will spend a pretty penny eating and drinking but it's definitely worth it! ( I recommend the wagyu burger)

originalText.text:
What a stunning venue to grab a drink! We literally loved coming here and although it was originally to live out our "Home Alone 2" dream, I'm so glad that we had drinks at The Champagne Bar.

The bartender, whose name I can't remember off the top of my head, was amazing and told us lots of stories about the hotel and all the people who had visited in the past. He was really kind and friendly and had been working there about 25+ years! He also gave us postcards that could then be mailed off to our family - it was such a cute idea and our family members loved it.

We loved coming here for a calm and quiet drink and would definitely recommend a visit!

originalText.text:
I had read some negative reviews before going but I have to say, upon being greeted at The Champagne Bar, any concerns were quickly dispelled.
My 2yr old daughter and I were made to feel so welcome, and were seated within 10 minutes. Service was attentive and the wagyu sliders and my kir royale were delicious. I would love to come again when back in New York! Thank you for making our evening!

text.text:

My 2yr old daughter and I were made to feel so welcome, and were seated within 10 minutes. Service was attentive and the wagyu sliders and my kir royale were delicious. I would love to come again when back in New York! Thank you for making our evening!

originalText.text: My sister and I decided to come to NY for my birthday and NY Eve and we loved this place! Everything was amazing! The ambiance, the staff, the food and the champagne cocktails! I loved the beautiful Christmas decorations throughout the place and especially in the main lobby!

text.text: My sister and I decided to come to NY for my birthday and NY Eve and we loved this place! Everything was amazing! The ambiance, the staff, the food and the champagne cocktails! I loved the beautiful Christmas decorations throughout the place and especially in the main lobby!

originalText.text:
I rarely give bad reviews, but the plaza champagne bar left me no choice. I have never before felt discriminated against based on how I'm dressed and what I look like until I arrived here.
I had been excited to get a champagne flight at the plaza champagne bar for months while planning my trip to NYC and I specifically emailed them ahead of time to ask whether they are open to children. They assured me that children are always welcome and that they have high chairs. They also specified that the bar is walk in only with no reservations accepted. This was fine because I intended in going on a Monday at 5 pm which I figured would be a low volume time.
Flash forward to when we arrive. It's pouring rain outside. The hotel employees at the front door did not even want to let us in with the wagon. Finally I entered with my toddler to check for availability at the bar. There, despite the fact that there were many empty tables, an employee told me they did not have room for us-- that all the tables were reserved for hotel guests (despite the no reservation policy). I tried to mention that we would likely only take an hour and that we travelled specifically to come there, but they still turned us away, back into the rain. I am convinced if I had come without children and dressed fancier, they would have let me in, but instead they turned away a paying customer for the possibility of no customers.
Needless to say the Plaza will not be getting our patronage ever again. We have no need for a place that thinks it's too good for our family.
